name: chicagotribune
text:
Chicago’s new top cop got testy when asked about the city's violent weekend; so did Mayor Lightfoot when asked whether she still has confidence in him.

Here are today’s top stories in Chicago politics, from @byldonovan: https://t.co/llbi9cWhJQ

name: chicagotribune
text: COVID-19 cases top 100,000 in Florida as US sees surge in infections in states across South and West https://t.co/BLIkunyYGW

name: chicagotribune
text:
Since @RexHuppke moved to Chicago 18 years ago, there have been roughly 7,000 homicides. How can the city let the carnage go on?

“The rich and powerful of Chicago have the gall to claim this city’s heart is breaking. This city’s heart seems unbreakable.” https://t.co/PpzDlm2YpS

name: chicagotribune
text:
A Chicago Board of Education member denies a newly released state watchdog report that he did campaign work while on the clock as an auditor for the Illinois Department of Employment Security
https://t.co/8A1vMYG1A3

name: chicagotribune
text: The Illinois Supreme Court announced on Monday that it would recruit a chief diversity and inclusion officer, acknowledging a need to address racism and to address “frailties in the disposition of justice” affecting people of color https://t.co/pLsq7xsshz

name: chicagotribune
text: After George Floyd’s death, where does Chicago draw the line on police chokeholds? https://t.co/RDr059RstE

name: chicagotribune
text: Seattle’s mayor said Monday that the city is working with the community to bring the “Capitol Hill Occupied Protest” zone to an end https://t.co/neGg1LcYCA

name: chicagotribune
text: “Cancel the race. It’s that simple. If NASCAR is really that worried, really that appalled by the vile action of the person who placed a noose in driver Bubba Wallace’s pit stall, show it. Put that money where that virtue signaling mouth is.” @TribuneKevin https://t.co/WTamYzJLsi

name: chicagotribune
text: The COVID-19 pandemic has been devastating for Chicago's theater community. Theater needs relief, as much if not more than many other industries, writes Lou Raizin, president of Broadway In Chicago. https://t.co/GvaTQdrgn8

name: chicagotribune
text: Let's create more national holidays that give us a chance to reflect on our history, not on individuals, historian @PatrickReardon writes in @ChiTribOpinions. https://t.co/NwT3vobntJ

name: chicagotribune
text: The family of Mekhi James, a 3-year-old who was killed over the weekend, joined in a small vigil in Austin on Monday: “Another mother has to bury another son and another dream dies” https://t.co/JjPX80Nwr5

name: chicagotribune
text: Despite student demands to cut ties with Chicago police, DePaul University said its educational relationship will continue https://t.co/huZecp2ZaV

name: chicagotribune
text:
“It’s the most volatility that we’ve seen in the cheese market ever.”

Cheese prices hit record high just weeks after hitting nearly 20-year lows. Here’s why the price has been so volatile. from The New York Times: https://t.co/4ATbcJIPAV

name: chicagotribune
text: Local officials welcomed Amazon's plan to open distribution centers in Matteson and Markham, and the 2,000 jobs that go with them. But they also want the company to use the long proposed south suburban airport as an air cargo hub. https://t.co/1u6NuJF0E3

name: chicagotribune
text: Vice President Mike Pence and a host of aides to Donald Trump have voted by mail repeatedly, a practice the president claims without evidence will lead to widespread fraud. https://t.co/4eESP9mzx4

name: chicagotribune
text: The Aon Center's plan to build an observatory with a thrill ride atop Chicago’s third-tallest skyscraper will start almost a year behind schedule because of the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/mBmWgk7KKp

name: chicagotribune
text:
Good morning, Chicago. Here are some top stories to start your day:
-Illinois to enter phase 4 of reopening on Friday
-Protests' impact on coronavirus in Chicago
-Laurence Holmes’ must-listen radio
https://t.co/KAmqjBrQxQ

name: chicagotribune
text: Another weekend of bloodshed in Chicago had given way to another round of police and city leaders grasping for explanations. https://t.co/AIUlDCsL78

name: chicagotribune
text: A breakfast sandwich made with imitation sausage is now available at a majority of Starbucks stores in the U.S., the first time the chain is offering a plant-based meat. https://t.co/IKO2b5HFqr

name: chicagotribune
text: Tennis star Novak Djokovic tested positive for the coronavirus on Tuesday after taking part in an exhibition series he organized in Serbia and Croatia. https://t.co/Q45T8X4WcT

name: chicagotribune
text: Federal authorities are warning consumers not to eat certain bagged salads from Jewel-Osco, Aldi and Hy-Vee as they investigate an outbreak of Cyclospora. https://t.co/XqKVRQcKP4

name: chicagotribune
text: Review: Jon Stewart's new political comedy, "Irresistible," is extremely condescending and unrelentingly cynical. https://t.co/YK5pIudE9c

name: chicagotribune
text: There are 600,000 residents in Louisville, but only one polling place will be open, despite a competitive Democratic primary race for a U.S. Senate seat. https://t.co/YJsLypImHr

name: chicagotribune
text: Chicagoans returned to the Lakefront and 606 trails on Monday, with social distance ambassadors urging people to keep it moving. Many people wore face masks, but many more did not. https://t.co/BMjsRulkD9

name: chicagotribune
text: So far, the available data shows no significant spikes in COVID-19 cases in Chicago, despite recent protests over the death of George Floyd https://t.co/W0Ms6cPirX

name: chicagotribune
text: Sen. Elizabeth Warren is great, but here's why columnist @heidistevens13 thinks she shouldn't be Joe Biden's running mate. https://t.co/Upo2Jl9teg

name: chicagotribune
text: Some Chicago suburbs and towns across the region are going forward with their July 4 firework celebrations. Here's a running list. https://t.co/N0cqmmRPIt

name: chicagotribune
text: COVID-19 in Illinois by ZIP code: Search for cases in your neighborhood https://t.co/LQKiIGjq7H

name: chicagotribune
text: Dr. Anthony Fauci returns to Congress for a House hearing as COVID-19 infections rise in half the country. Watch it live here: https://t.co/1uHtircLW0

name: chicagotribune
text: Commentary: Cancel culture and shortsighted activism killed Chicago's iO improv theater. https://t.co/I7tVTgeECs

name: chicagotribune
text: The Sears Centre Arena in Hoffman Estates will be renamed NOW Arena https://t.co/rAToAm0R4E

name: chicagotribune
text: DePaul University Provost Salma Ghanem turned down student demands to cut ties with Chicago police, saying that “the actions of a few do not represent the (CPD officers) we teach.” https://t.co/krJt6HYU9E

name: chicagotribune
text: A shortened 60-game baseball season would be a major accomplishment during this coronavirus pandemic, writes @MDGonzales https://t.co/UrTsTQ9NpW

name: chicagotribune
text:
What will college football look like when it returns? Who, if anyone, gets to attend? And is it wise even to try to play?

@TeddyGreenstein and @sryantribune talk it out. https://t.co/2YHiVHNUjc

name: chicagotribune
text: A vast cloud of Saharan dust is blanketing the Caribbean as it heads to the U.S. with a size and concentration that experts say hasn’t been seen in half a century. https://t.co/zxpWG58bGf

name: chicagotribune
text: As Chicago and the rest of Illinois moves to phase 4 of the coronavirus reopening plan on Friday, here's a guide to what's allowed. https://t.co/LAW3Mju4gC

name: chicagotribune
text: Dr. Anthony Fauci told members of Congress on Tuesday that he believes “it will be when and not if” there will be a COVID-19 vaccine and that he remains “cautiously optimistic” that some will be ready at the end of the year. https://t.co/27RPXBGm8S

name: chicagotribune
text: President Donald Trump says he will issue an executive order to protect monuments that have been targets of activists during recent protests https://t.co/ENlrCBF4Uj

name: chicagotribune
text: A powerful earthquake shook southern and central Mexico on Tuesday morning, swaying buildings in Mexico City and sending thousands into the streets. https://t.co/uEWl0jYJIc

name: chicagotribune
text:
“Magic: The Gathering” has removed seven cards with racist names and imagery from its popular game.

Report from The New York Times: https://t.co/e6TlnAuujf

name: chicagotribune
text: Chicago has seen a 700% jump in calls complaining about fireworks so far this year https://t.co/EsQkJ0HcJr

name: chicagotribune
text: Chicago restaurants continue to come under fire on social media for alleged racism and sexism. One Instagram account in particular is unearthing years of misdeeds. https://t.co/6KnzSKLy9e

name: chicagotribune
text: Chicago is setting up mobile COVID-19 testing sites to get more tests to first responders and residents of neighborhoods hit hard by the pandemic https://t.co/srDOJa7JL9

name: chicagotribune
text: Police in Manchester, England, are investigating after a plane pulling a banner containing the message “White Lives Matter Burnley” flew over a Premier League soccer match, drawing condemnation from players and politicians https://t.co/Rthil2vGJV

name: chicagotribune
text: Teens are leading an effort to rename a Kenilworth school. But siblings from the family they suggested naming the school after aren’t convinced. https://t.co/OUOzJlcSRB

name: chicagotribune
text: Watch live as Gov. J.B. Pritzker shares updates on the coronavirus outbreak in Illinois https://t.co/NShC4oTeNs

name: chicagotribune
text: Illinois will enter phase 4 of its coronavirus reopening plan Friday. Here’s a guide to what’s allowed. https://t.co/nNxf96mBtx

name: chicagotribune
text: A northwest Indiana man was killed in a fall on Saturday while he was trimming trees in Ogden Dunes https://t.co/bbMsgeKELV

name: chicagotribune
text: Illinois officials offer school districts guidance for reopening to in-person classes this fall, including required use of face coverings, temperature checks, more cleaning and social distancing “as much as possible” https://t.co/UZMzfKTPNM

name: chicagotribune
text: Some Chicago suburbs and towns across the region are going forward with their July 4 firework celebrations. Here's a running list. https://t.co/5vTdkk2Z5S

name: chicagotribune
text: Police suspect foul play in the death of a Belvidere man whose body was found last week in the Little Calumet River in Blue Island. https://t.co/buQmE0oJkT

name: chicagotribune
text: A federal prosecutor is prepared to tell Congress on Wednesday that Roger Stone was given special treatment ahead of his sentencing because of his relationship with President Trump https://t.co/Yt6PRqz35O

name: chicagotribune
text:
Tracking COVID-19 in Illinois:
• 6,707 deaths
• 137,825 confirmed cases
• 1.4 million tests

See more data here: https://t.co/hOsLcwqu3A

name: chicagotribune
text: Congress hit an impasse on policing legislation Tuesday, leaving Democrats and Republicans to decide whether to take on the hard job of negotiating a compromise or walk away despite public outcry over the killings of Black Americans https://t.co/KLX5lDS0DA
